arlin.analysis.visualization.visualization

Module Contents

Classes

GraphData

Class to save data that can be graphed in matplotlib.

Functions

graph_multiple_data(file_path, figure_title, graph_datas)

Graph multiple GraphDatas in the same figure.

graph_individual_data(filename, data)

Graph given GraphData to a single plot and save a PNG to the given file.
class arlin.analysis.visualization.visualization.GraphData(x, y, title, colors=None, legend=None, cmap=None, error_bars=None, xlabel=None, ylabel=None, showall=False)

Class to save data that can be graphed in matplotlib.

Initialize a GraphData object.

Parameters:

  • x (np.ndarray) – X axis data

  • y (np.ndarray) – Y axis data

  • title (str) – Title of the graph

  • colors (Optional[List[str]], optional) – Point color for each datapoint. Defaults to None.

  • legend (Optional[Dict], optional) – Add a legend to the side of the graph. Defaults to None.

  • cmap (Optional[str], optional) – Add a colorbar to the side of the graph. Defaults to None.

  • error_bars (Optional[List[float]], optional) – Error bars for each datapoint. Defaults to None.

  • xlabel (Optional[str], optional) – Xlabels for the graph. Defaults to None.

  • ylabel (Optional[str], optional) – Ylabels for the graph. Defaults to None.

  • showall (bool, optional) – Show all axis in the figure. Defaults to False.

get_data()

Get the data from within this GraphData.

Returns:

Dictionary with all stored class information.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

arlin.analysis.visualization.visualization.graph_multiple_data(file_path, figure_title, graph_datas, horizontal=True)

Graph multiple GraphDatas in the same figure.

Parameters:

  • file_path (str) – Path to save figure to.

  • figure_title (str) – Title of the combination graph.

  • graph_datas (List[GraphData]) – GraphDatast to graph together.

  • horizontal (bool, optional) – Whether the figure should be wider than it is tall.

  • True. (Defaults to) –

Return type:

None

arlin.analysis.visualization.visualization.graph_individual_data(filename, data)

Graph given GraphData to a single plot and save a PNG to the given file.

Parameters:

  • data (GraphData) – Data necessary to graph and individual plot.

  • filename (str) – Name for the PNG file.

Return type:

None
